metadata.title: CVE-2024-21890 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description: The Node.js Permission Model does not clarify in the documentation thatwildcards should be only used as the last character of a file path. Forexample: ``` --allow-fs-read=/home/node/.ssh/*.pub ``` will ignore `pub`and give access to everything after `.ssh/`. This misleading documentationaffects all users using the experimental permission model in Node.js 20 andNode.js 21. Please note that at the time this CVE was issued, thepermission model is an experimental feature of Node.js.

criterions.comment: nodejs package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
